title: Complete addIceCandidate error response from client to server
description:
Encapsulates a client-to-device message sent via the signaling server.
This flavour of the signaling message defines the format that the client must use when sending.

type.description: Specifies this message as a signaling message

targetId.description: The target id to which the client wants to send the client-to-device message

orgId.description: The id of the organization that the device belongs to.

accessToken.description: Token from `auth.axis.com` for the logged in user.

P2P.title: addIceCandidate error response
P2P.description: This message indicates the responder failed to validate the request.

apiVersion.description:
The API version actually used by the responder.
Note that this schema documents a specific version which makes this property a constant here.
A requestor should be prepared to receive a response with a different minor version in which case the response is fully defined by the schema corresponding to that minor version.

type.description: Specifies that this message is a response

sessionId.description: An identifier chosen by the client that should be used for all messages belonging to this session.

context.description: Echoes back the corresponding data from the request.

id.description: A string chosen by the requestor that may be used for debugging purposes.

error.description: The presence of an error object indicates a failed validation

code.description: A numeric error code intended for machine interpretation.

message.description: A descriptive error message intended for human interpretation.
